translated: May the Tathagatas remove my afflictions, karma, and fruits.

original: snāpayantu ca māṃ buddhāḥ kāruṇyavimalodakaiḥ // / //🔽sarvapāpaṃ deśayāmi yattu pūrvaṃ kṛtaṃ mayā /
analyzed: snāpayantu ca mām buddhāḥ kāruṇya vimala udakaiḥ  sarva pāpam deśayāmi yat tu pūrvam kṛtam mayā
translated: May the Buddhas bathe me with the pure water of compassion.🔽I confess all the evil I have done in the past,

original: yacca hyetarhi me pāpaṃ tatsarvaṃ deśayāmyaham // / //🔽āyatyā sarvamāpadyansarvaduṣkṛtakarmaṇā /
analyzed: yat ca hi etarhi me pāpam tat sarvam deśayāmi aham  āyatyā sarvam āpadyan sarva duṣkṛta karmaṇā
translated: and whatever evil I have done now, I confess it all.🔽In the future, whatever bad deeds I may commit,

analyzed: na chādayāmi tat pāpam yat bhavet mama duṣkṛtam
translated: I will not conceal that evil, whatever bad I may have done.

original: trividhaṃ kāyikaṃ karma vācikaṃ tu caturvidham /
analyzed: trividham kāyikam karma vācikam tu caturvidham
translated: There are three kinds of physical actions and four kinds of verbal actions,

analyzed: mānasam tri prakāram ca tat sarvam deśayāmi aham
translated: and three types of mental actions - I confess them all.

original: kāyakṛtaṃ ca vākkṛtaṃ manasā ca vicintitam /
analyzed: kāya kṛtam ca vāc kṛtam manasā ca vicintitam
translated: Whatever I have done with the body, said with the voice, or thought with the mind,

analyzed: kṛtam daśavidham karma tat sarvam deśayāmi aham
translated: I confess all those ten types of actions that I have done.

analyzed: varjitvā sevitvā kuśalān daśa
translated: Having abandoned the ten unwholesome [actions] and practiced the ten wholesome [actions],

analyzed: sthāsyāmi daśa bhūmau ca paśye daśa bala uttamam
translated: I will abide in the ten grounds and see the supreme one with the ten powers.

analyzed: bagchi
translated: [Sanskrit text]

analyzed: yat ca me pāpakam karma aniṣṭa phala vāhakam
translated: Whatever sinful karma I have, which brings forth undesirable results,

original: tatsarvaṃ deśayiṣyāmi buddhānāṃ purataḥ sthitaḥ // / //🔽ye cāpi jambudvīpe 'sminye cānyalokadhātuṣu /
analyzed: tat sarvam deśayiṣyāmi buddhānām puratas sthitaḥ  ye ca api jambudvīpe smin ye ca anya lokadhātuṣu
translated: I will confess all of that, standing in the presence of the Buddhas.🔽And whatever wholesome actions are being done in this Jambudvipa, and in other world systems,

analyzed: kurvanti kuśalam karma tat sarvam anumodaye
translated: I rejoice in all of that.

analyzed: yat ca puṇya arjitam mahyam kāya vāc bha nasā api ca
translated: And whatever merit I have earned through body, speech, and mind,

analyzed: tena kuśala mūlena spṛśeyam bodhim uktamām
translated: By that root of virtue, may I touch the bliss of enlightenment.

original: bhavagatisaṃkaṭabālabuddhinā pāpaṃ hyapi yacca kṛtaṃ sudāruṇam /
analyzed: bhava gati saṃkaṭa bāla buddhinā pāpam hi api yat ca kṛtam su dāruṇam
translated: Whatever extremely terrible sins I have committed with a childish and confused mind in the dangerous paths of existence,

analyzed: daśabala saṃmukham agratas sthitaḥ tat sarva pāpam pratideśayāmi ca
translated: Standing before the Ten Powered One, I confess all those sins.

analyzed: tat pāpam samuccitam janma saṃkaṭe vividha kāma pracāra saṃkaṭe
translated: That accumulated sin in the dangerous paths of birth, in the dangerous paths of various sensual pursuits,

analyzed: loka saṃkaṭe bhava saṃkaṭe ca sarva mūrkha kṛta kleśa saṃkaṭe
translated: In the dangerous paths of the world and of existence, in the dangerous paths created by all foolish afflictions,

analyzed: cāpalya madana citta saṃkaṭe pāpa mitra āgama saṃkaṭaiḥ api
translated: In the narrow passages of fickle, lustful, and agitated minds, in the narrow passages of associating with bad friends,

analyzed: saṃsāra saṃkaṭa rāga saṃkaṭe dveṣa moha tama saṃkaṭaiḥ api
translated: In the narrow passages of the narrow passages of the world, in the narrow passages of attachment, aversion, and delusion,

analyzed: akṣaya saṃkaṭa kāla saṃkaṭe puṇyam apārjana saṃkaṭaiḥ api
translated: In the narrow passages of the narrow passages of inexhaustible time, in the narrow passages of not accumulating merit,

analyzed: atuliya jina saṃmukha sthitaḥ tat sarva pāpam pratideśayāmi ca
translated: Standing in the presence of the incomparable Victorious Ones, I confess all those evil deeds.

analyzed: vandāmi buddhān guṇa sāgara upamān suvarṇa varṇa an avabhāsita diś antān
translated: I pay homage to the Buddhas, who are like oceans of qualities, golden in color, illuminating the ends of the directions.

original: teṣāṃ jinānāṃ śaraṇaṃ vrajāmi mūrdhrā ca tānsarvajinānnamāmi // / //🔽suvarṇavarṇaṃ kanakācalābham vaiḍūryanirmalaviśuddhasulocanāṅgam /
analyzed: teṣām jinānām śaraṇam vrajāmi mūrdhrā ca tān sarva jinān namāmi  suvarṇa varṇam kanaka acala ābham vaiḍūrya nirmala viśuddha su locana aṅgam
translated: I go for refuge to those Victorious Ones, and with my head I bow down to all those Victorious Ones.🔽Golden in color, like a golden mountain, with eyes pure and clear like lapis lazuli,

analyzed: śrī teja kīrti jvalana ākara buddha sūryam karuṇā prabham vidhamakam tamasā andhakānām
translated: The sun-like Buddha, a source of the blazing light of glory, splendor, and fame, the light of compassion, dispelling the darkness of blinding darkness.

analyzed: bagchi
translated: Bagchi

analyzed: su nirmalam su ruciram su virājita aṅgam saṃbuddha sūrya kanaka amala niḥsṛta aṅgam
translated: Pure, very beautiful, with a body shining brilliantly, with a body emanating from the golden spotless sun of the Fully Enlightened One,

analyzed: kleśa agni tapta manasām jvalana agni kalpam prahlādanam muni niśākara raśmi jālam
translated: The net of rays of the moon of sages, cooling the burning fire-like passions of those whose minds are tormented by the fire of afflictions.

analyzed: dvātriṃśa lakṣaṇa dharam lalita indriya aṅgam anuvyañjanaḥ su ruciram su virājita aṅgam
translated: You who bear the thirty-two marks, with limbs graceful and pliant, with the minor marks, so lovely and radiant,

original: śrīpuṇyatejajvalanākularaśmijālaṃ saṃtiṣṭhase tamasi sūrya iva triloke // / //
analyzed: śrī puṇya teja jvalana ākula raśmi jālam saṃtiṣṭhase tamasi sūryaḥ iva triloke
translated: You shine in the darkness like the sun in the three worlds, with a net of rays blazing with the splendor of merit and glory.

analyzed: vaiḍūrya nirmala viśāla vicitra varṇaḥ tāmra aruṇaiḥ rajata sphaṭika lohita aṅgam
translated: With a pure, vast, variegated color like lapis lazuli, with reddish-brown, silver, crystal, and red limbs,

analyzed: nānā vicitra samalaṅkṛta raśmi jālam tvam saṃvirocasi mahā muni sūrya kalpaḥ
translated: You shine forth, O Great Sage, like the sun, with a net of rays adorned with various colors.

analyzed: saṃsāra nadī a patita vyasana ogha madhye śoka ākule maraṇa toya jarā taraṅge
translated: In the middle of the ocean of existence, fallen into the flood of calamities, agitated by grief, with the waves of death and old age,

analyzed: duḥkha arṇave parama kampita caṇḍa vege saṃtāraya sugata bhāskara raśmi jālaiḥ
translated: In the ocean of suffering, with extremely agitated and violent waves, deliver us with the net of rays of the sun of the Sugata.

analyzed: vandāmi buddhān kanaka ujvala aṅgān suvarṇa varṇa vyavabhāsita aṅgān
translated: I pay homage to the Buddhas, whose bodies shine like gold, whose limbs are illuminated by the golden color,

original: jñānākarān sarvatrilokasārān vicitrarūpān śubhalakṣaṇāṅgān // / //🔽yathā samudre jalamaprameyaṃ yathā mahī cāṇurajairanantā /
analyzed: jñāna ākarān sarva triloka sārān vicitra rūpān śubha lakṣaṇa aṅgān  yathā samudre jalam aprameyam yathā mahī ca aṇuḥ ajaiḥ anantā
translated: The sources of knowledge, the essence of all the three worlds, with various forms and auspicious marks on their limbs.🔽Just as the water in the ocean is immeasurable, just as the earth is endless with its tiny particles,

analyzed: yathā upalaiḥ meruḥ ananta tulyaḥ yathā eva ca ākāśam ananta pāram
translated: Just as Meru is equal to infinity with its rocks, and just as space has no end or limit,

original: tathaiva buddhasya guṇā anantāḥ na śakya jñātuṃ khalu sarvasattvaiḥ /🔽Bagchi
analyzed: tathā eva buddhasya guṇāḥ anantāḥ na śakya jñātum khalu sarva sattvaiḥ  bagchi
translated: In the same way, the qualities of the Buddha are infinite, and indeed all beings are unable to know them.

original: anekakalpāni tu cintayante na śakya paryantaguṇāni jñātum // / //
analyzed: aneka kalpāni tu cintayante na śakya paryanta guṇāni jñātum
translated: Even if they contemplate for many eons, they are unable to know the limit of his qualities.

original: mahī saśailā sagiriḥ sasāgarā gaṇaṃ tu kalpairapi śakya jānitum /
analyzed: mahī sa śailā sa giriḥ sa sāgarā gaṇam tu kalpaiḥ api śakya jānitum
translated: The earth with its mountains, forests, and oceans can be known in groups even in eons,

original: jalaṃ ca vālāgramapi pramāṇaṃ na śakya buddhasya guṇāgrapāram // / //
analyzed: jalam ca vāla agram api pramāṇam na buddhasya guṇa agra pāram
translated: But the limit of the Buddha's supreme qualities cannot be known even with the measure of a drop of water from the ocean.

original: etādṛśī sattva bhavantu sarve guṇena varṇena yaśena koṭyā /
analyzed: etādṛśī sattva bhavantu sarve guṇena varṇena yaśena koṭyā
translated: May all beings become like this, with qualities, beauty, and fame a hundred times greater,

analyzed: gātreṇa te śobhita lakṣaṇena aśīti anuvyañjana maṇḍitena
translated: With bodies adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: anena cāhaṃ kuśalena karmaṇā bhaveya buddho na cireṇa loke /
analyzed: anena ca aham kuśalena karmaṇā bhaveya buddhaḥ na cireṇa loke
translated: By this wholesome action, may I become a Buddha in the world soon,

original: deśeya dharmaṃ jagato hitāya moceya sattvānbahuduḥkhapīḍitān // / //
analyzed: deśeya dharmam jagataḥ hitāya moceya sattvān bahu duḥkha pīḍitān
translated: And teach the Dharma for the benefit of the world, liberating beings afflicted by much suffering.

original: jayeya māraṃ sabalaṃ sasainyaṃ pravartayeyaṃ śubhadharmacakram /
analyzed: jayeya māram sa balam sa sainyam pravartayeyam śubha dharmacakram
translated: May I conquer Mara with his army and forces, and set in motion the auspicious Dharma wheel,

original: tiṣṭheya kalpāni acintiyāni tarpeya sattvānamṛtena pāṇinā // / //
analyzed: tiṣṭheya kalpāni acintiyāni tarpeya sattvān amṛtena pāṇinā
translated: And may I remain for inconceivable eons, satisfying beings with the nectar of Dharma.

original: pūreya ṣaṭpāramitā anuttarā yathaiva pūrvaṃ jinapūrvakānām /
analyzed: pūreya ṣaṣ pāramitāḥ anuttarāḥ yathā eva pūrvam jina pūrvakānām
translated: I would fulfill the six perfections, as did the Victors of the past,

original: haneya kleśānvidhameya duḥkhān śameya rāgāṃstatha dveṣamohān // / //
analyzed: haneya kleśān vidhameya duḥkhān śameya rāgān dveṣa mohān
translated: I would destroy the afflictions and end suffering, I would pacify desire, hatred, and delusion...

original: jātismaro nitya bhaveya cāhaṃ jātiśatā jātisahasrakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: jāti smaraḥ bhaveya ca aham jāti śatāḥ jāti sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: I would always remember my past lives, for hundreds, thousands, and millions of lifetimes,

original: anusmareyaṃ satataṃ munīndraṃ śṛṇvīya teṣāṃ vacanaṃ hyudāram // / //
analyzed: anusmareyam satatam muni indram śṛṇvīya teṣām vacanam hi udāram
translated: I would always remember the Lord of Sages and listen to their vast teachings...

analyzed: bagchi
translated: Bagchi

original: anena cāhaṃ kuśalena karmaṇā labheya buddhehi sadā samāgamam /
analyzed: anena ca aham kuśalena karmaṇā labheya sadā samāgamam
translated: By this wholesome action, may I always meet with the Buddhas,

original: vivarjayeyaṃ khalu pāpakarma careya puṇyāni śubhākarāṇi // / //
analyzed: vivarjayeyam khalu pāpa karma careya puṇyāni śubha ākarāṇi
translated: And avoid evil deeds, and perform meritorious acts that bring about goodness...

original: sarvatra kṣetreṣu ca sarvaprāṇināṃ sarve ca pāpāḥ praśamantu loke /
analyzed: sarvatra kṣetreṣu ca sarva prāṇinām sarve ca pāpāḥ praśamantu loke
translated: In all realms, may all the sufferings of all beings be pacified in the world,

original: ye sattvā vikalendriya aṅgahīnāḥ te sarvi kuśalendriya bhontu sāṃpratam // / //
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ vikala indriya aṅga hīnāḥ te kuśala indriya bhontu sāṃpratam
translated: May all beings who are deficient in faculties or limbs be endowed with wholesome faculties right now...

analyzed: ye vyādhinā durbala kṣīṇa gātrāḥ niśrāṇa bhūtāḥ ca daśa diśāsu
translated: Those whose bodies are weak and emaciated by disease, who are a refuge in the ten directions,

original: te sarvi mucyantu ca vyādhito laghu labhantu cārogyabalendriyāni // / //
analyzed: te mucyantu ca vyādhitaḥ laghu labhantu ca ārogya bala indriyāni
translated: May they all be quickly freed from disease and attain health, strength, and faculties...

analyzed: ku rāja caura samārjita badhya prāptāḥ nānāvidhaiḥ maya śataiḥ vyasana upapannāḥ
translated: Those who are imprisoned, bound, and tortured by bad kings, thieves, and enemies, who have fallen into various hundreds of calamities,

original: te sarvi sattvā vyasanāgataduḥkhitā hi mucyantu te bhayaśataiḥ paramaiḥ sughoraiḥ // / //🔽ye pīḍitā bandhanabaddhapīḍitā vividheṣu vyasaneṣu saṃsthitā hi /
analyzed: te sarvi sattvāḥ vyasana āgata duḥkhitāḥ hi mucyantu te bhaya śataiḥ paramaiḥ su ghoraiḥ  ye pīḍitāḥ bandhana baddha pīḍitāḥ vividheṣu vyasaneṣu saṃsthitāḥ hi
translated: May all those beings who are suffering from calamities and misfortune be freed from hundreds of terrifying and extremely dreadful dangers.

analyzed: aneka āyāsa sahasra vyākulāḥ vicitra bhaya dāruṇa śoka prāptāḥ
translated: Those who are afflicted, tortured by imprisonment, and caught in various calamities, who are troubled by thousands of hardships, and have encountered various terrifying and dreadful sorrows,

original: te sarve mucyantu ca bandhanebhyaḥ saṃtāḍitā mucyantu ca tāḍanebhyaḥ /
analyzed: te sarve mucyantu ca bandhanebhyaḥ saṃtāḍitāḥ mucyantu ca tāḍanebhyaḥ
translated: May they all be freed from their bonds. Those who are beaten may be freed from their beatings.

original: vadhyāśca mucyantu jīvitebhyo vyasanāgatā nirbhayā bhontu sarve // / //
analyzed: vadhyāḥ ca mucyantu jīvitebhyaḥ vyasana āgatāḥ nirbhayāḥ bhontu sarve
translated: Those who are sentenced to death may be freed from their lives. May all those who have fallen into misfortune be free from fear.

original: ye sattva kṣuttarṣanipīḍitāśca labhantu te bhojanapānacitram /
analyzed: ye kṣudh tarṣa nipīḍitāḥ ca labhantu te bhojana pāna citram
translated: Those beings who are afflicted by hunger and thirst, may they obtain various kinds of food and drink.

analyzed: bagchi
translated: Bagchi

original: andhāśca paśyantu vicitrarūpān vadhirāśca śṛṇvantu manojñaghoṣān // / //
analyzed: andhāḥ ca paśyantu vicitra rūpān vadhirāḥ ca śṛṇvantu manojña ghoṣān
translated: May the blind see various forms, and may the deaf hear delightful sounds.

original: nagnāśca vastrāṇi labhantu citrā daridrasattvāśca dhanāṃllabhantu /
analyzed: nagnāḥ ca vastrāṇi labhantu citrāḥ daridra sattvāḥ ca dhanān labhantu
translated: May the naked obtain various garments, and may poor beings obtain wealth.

original: prabhūtadhanadhānyavicitraratnāḥ sarve ca sattvāḥ sukhino bhavantu // / //
analyzed: prabhūta dhana dhānya vicitra ratnāḥ sarve ca sattvāḥ sukhinaḥ bhavantu
translated: And may all beings have abundant wealth, grain, and various jewels, and may they all be happy.

original: mā kasyaciddhāvatu duḥkhavedanā sudarśanāḥ sattva bhavantu sarve /
analyzed: mā kasyacid dhāvatu duḥkha vedanā su darśanāḥ sattva bhavantu sarve
translated: May no one experience painful feelings, and may all beings be beautiful.

analyzed: abhirūpa prāsādika saumya rūpāḥ aneka sukha saṃcita nitya bhontu
translated: May they always have a pleasant appearance, be attractive, and accumulate much happiness.

original: manaḥśāntapaurāḥ susamṛddhapuṇyāḥ vīṇā mṛdaṅgā paṭahā sughoṣā /
analyzed: manaḥ śānta paurāḥ su samṛddha puṇyāḥ vīṇā mṛdaṅgā paṭahā sughoṣā
translated: May their minds be peaceful, and may they have abundant merit. May vīṇās, mṛdaṅgas, and paṭahas sound sweetly,

analyzed: utsāḥ sarāḥ puṣkariṇī taḍāgāḥ suvarṇa padma utpala padminībhiḥ
translated: And may lakes, ponds, and pools be filled with the fragrance of golden lotuses and blue lotuses.

original: sahacittamātreṇa tu teṣa bhontu annaṃ ca pānaṃ ca tathaiva vastram /
analyzed: saha citta mātreṇa tu annam ca pānam ca tathā eva vastram
translated: May they have food, drink, and clothing merely by the thought of it,

analyzed: dhanam hiraṇyam maṇi mukti bhūṣaṇam suvarṇa vaiḍūrya vicitra ratnam
translated: Wealth, gold, jewels, ornaments, gold, lapis lazuli, and various precious gems.

original: mā duḥkhaśabdāḥ kvaci loki bhontu bhā caikasattvaḥ pratikūladarśī /
analyzed: mā duḥkha śabdāḥ kvacid loki bhontu bhā ca eka sattvaḥ pratikūla darśī
translated: May there never be any painful sounds in the world, and may not even a single being have an unfavorable view of another.

original: sarve ca te bhontu udāravarṇāḥ prabhākarā bhontu paraspareṇa // / //
analyzed: sarve ca te bhontu udāra varṇāḥ prabhākarāḥ bhontu paraspareṇa
translated: May they all have an excellent complexion, and may they be radiant with light from one another.

original: yā kāci saṃpatti manuṣyaloke sā teṣu bhotū manasopapattiḥ /🔽Bagchi
analyzed: yā kāci manuṣya loke sā teṣu manasā upapattiḥ 🔽bagchi
translated: May they have whatever wealth there is in the human world, and may it arise in their minds.

analyzed: sarva abhiprāyā saha citta mātraiḥ puṇyena phalena paripūrayantu
translated: May they fulfill all their aspirations with the merit of a single thought.

original: gandhaṃ ca mālyaṃ ca vilepanaṃ ca dhūpaṃ ca cūrṇaṃ kusumaṃ ca pūrṇam /
analyzed: gandham ca mālyam ca vilepanam ca dhūpam ca cūrṇam kusumam ca pūrṇam
translated: Perfume, garlands, ointments, incense, powders, and flowers are all complete.

original: trikāle vṛkṣehi pravarṣayantu gṛhṇantu te sattva bhavantu tuṣṭāḥ // / //
analyzed: trikāle pravarṣayantu gṛhṇantu te sattva bhavantu tuṣṭāḥ
translated: May they rain down from the trees at the three times. May beings receive them and be satisfied.

original: kurvantu pūjāṃ daśasū diśāsu acintiyāṃ sarvatathāgatānām /
analyzed: kurvantu pūjām diśāsu acintiyām sarva tathāgatānām
translated: They should make inconceivable offerings in the ten directions to all Tathagatas,

analyzed: sa bodhisattvān sa śrāvakāṇām dharmasya bodhi pratisaṃsthitasya
translated: To the Bodhisattvas, to the Shravakas, and to the Dharma established in enlightenment.

original: nīcāṃ gatiṃ sarvi vivarjayantu tarantu aṣṭāṅgikavīcivṛttāḥ /
analyzed: nīcām gatim sarvi vivarjayantu tarantu aṣṭāṅgika vīci vṛttāḥ
translated: May they all turn away from the lower realms, and may they cross over the eight worldly concerns.

original: āsādayantu jinarājamūrti labhantu buddhehi sadā samāgamam // / //
analyzed: āsādayantu jina rāja mūrti labhantu sadā samāgamam
translated: May they attain the form of the Victorious Ones, and may they always meet with the Buddhas.

original: uccaiḥ kulīnā hi bhavantu nityaṃ prabhūtadhanadhānyasamṛddhakośāḥ /
analyzed: uccais kulīnāḥ hi bhavantu nityam prabhūta dhana dhānya samṛddha kośāḥ
translated: May they always be of high birth, with abundant wealth, grain, and prosperous treasuries.

original: rūpeṇa śauryeṇa yaśena kīrtyā samalaṅkṛtā bhontu anekakalpān // / //
analyzed: rūpeṇa śauryeṇa yaśena kīrtyā samalaṅkṛtāḥ bhontu aneka kalpān
translated: May they be adorned for many eons with beauty, heroism, fame, and renown.

original: sarvā striyo nitya narā bhavantu śūrāśca vīrāśca vijñapaṇḍitāśca /
analyzed: sarvāḥ striyaḥ nitya narāḥ bhavantu śūrāḥ ca vīrāḥ ca vijña paṇḍitāḥ ca
translated: May all women always become men, heroic, brave, wise, and learned.

original: te sarvi bodhāya carantu nityaṃ carantu te pāramitāsu ṣaṭsu // / //
analyzed: te sarvi bodhāya carantu nityam carantu te pāramitāsu ṣaṭsu

original: ayaṃ ca kāyo yatha śūnyagrāmaḥ ṣaḍgrāma coropama indriyāṇi /
analyzed: ayam ca kāyaḥ śūnya grāmaḥ cora upamaḥ indriyāṇi
translated: This body is like an empty village, and the six senses are like six thieves.

original: tānyekagrāme nivasanti sarve na te vijānanti paraspareṇa // / //
analyzed: tāni eka grāme nivasanti sarve na te vijānanti paraspareṇa
translated: They all dwell in one village, but they do not know each other.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ indriyam rūpam eteṣu dhāvati śrotra indriyam śabda vicāraṇena
translated: The eye faculty runs towards forms, the ear faculty with the discrimination of sounds,

original: ghrāṇendriyaṃ gandhavicitrahāri jihvandriyaṃ nitya raseṣu dhāvati // / //🔽Bagchi
analyzed: ghrāṇa indriyam gandha vicitra hāri raseṣu dhāvati  bagchi
translated: The nose faculty carries away the various fragrances, the tongue faculty always runs towards tastes.

analyzed: kāya indriyam sparśa gataḥ abhidhāvati manā indriyam dharma vicāraṇena
translated: The body faculty runs towards tactile objects, the mind faculty with the discrimination of phenomena.

analyzed: ṣaḍ indriyāṇi iti paraspareṇa svakam svakam viṣayam abhidhāvati
translated: The six faculties run towards their respective objects, each towards its own object.

original: cittaṃ hi māyopama cañcalaṃ ca ṣaḍindriyaṃ viṣayavicāraṇaṃ ca /
analyzed: cittam hi māyā upama cañcalam ca ṣaṣ indriyam viṣaya vicāraṇam ca
translated: The mind is like an illusion, wavering, the six faculties and the discrimination of objects,

original: yathā naro dhāvati śūnyagrāme saṃgrāma caurebhi samāśritaśca // / //
analyzed: yathā naraḥ dhāvati śūnya grāme saṃgrāma caurebhiḥ samāśritaḥ ca
translated: Just as a man runs in an empty village, relying on a battle with thieves.

original: cittaṃ yathā ṣaḍviṣayāśritaṃ ca prajānate indriya gocaraṃ ca /
analyzed: cittam yathā ṣaṣ viṣaya āśritam ca prajānate indriya gocaram ca
translated: One should understand how the mind relies on the six objects and the range of the faculties,

original: rūpaṃ ca śabdaṃ ca tathaiva gandhaṃ rasaṃ ca sparśa tatha dharmagocaram // / //
analyzed: rūpam ca śabdam ca tathā eva gandham rasam ca dharma gocaram
translated: Form, sound, and likewise smell, taste, touch, and the range of phenomena.

original: cittaṃ ca sarvatra ṣaḍindriyeṣu śakuniriva cañcalaṃ indriyasaṃpraviṣṭam /
analyzed: cittam ca sarvatra ṣaṣ indriyeṣu śakuniḥ iva cañcalam indriya saṃpraviṣṭam
translated: The mind is in all six faculties, like a bird, wavering, entering the faculties.

original: yatra yatrendriyasaṃśritaṃ ca na cendriyaṃ kurvatu jānamātmakam // / //
analyzed: yatra yatra indriya saṃśritam ca na ca indriyam kurvatu
translated: Wherever it relies on the faculties, but the faculties do not make the mind know itself.

original: kāyaśca niśceṣṭa nirvyāpāraṃ ca asārakaḥ pratyayasaṃbhavaśca /
analyzed: kāyaḥ ca niśceṣṭa nirvyāpāram ca asārakaḥ pratyaya saṃbhavaḥ ca
translated: And the body is motionless, inactive, insubstantial, and arises from conditions.

analyzed: abhūta vikalpa samutthitaḥ ca sthita karma yantram śūnya grāmaḥ
translated: Like an empty village arisen from unreal imagination, a machine of fixed action.

analyzed: bagchi
translated: Bagchi

analyzed: kṣiti ambha tejaḥ nilāni yathā caura grāma antar deśa deśe
translated: Just as the earth, water, fire, and wind are in different places in the village of thieves,

original: paraspareṇaiva sadā viruddhā yathaiva āśīviṣa ekaveśmani // / //
analyzed: paraspareṇa eva sadā viruddhāḥ yathā eva āśīviṣaḥ eka veśmani
translated: Mutually always opposed, like four poisonous snakes in one house.

original: dhātūragāste ca caturvidhāni dve ūrdhvagāmī dvaya heṣṭagāmī /
analyzed: ca caturvidhāni dve ūrdhva gāmī
translated: Those four elements are two that move upward and two that move downward.

original: dvayādvayaṃ diśi vidiśāsu sarvaṃ naśyanti tā dhātubhujaṅgamāni // / //🔽kṣityuragaśca saliloragaśca imau ca heṣṭā kṣayatāṃ vrajete /
analyzed: dvayādvayam diśi vidiśāsu sarvam naśyanti tā dhātu bhujaṅgamāni  kṣiti uragaḥ ca salila uragaḥ ca imau ca heṣṭā kṣaya tām vrajete
translated: The two pairs, single and double, in all directions and intermediate directions, those elements and snakes perish.🔽The earth snake and the water snake, these two go to destruction below.

original: tejoragaścānilamārutoraga imau hi dve ūrdhvagatau nabho 'nte // / //
analyzed: teja uragaḥ ca anila māruta uragaḥ imau hi dve ūrdhva gatau
translated: The fire snake and the wind snake, these two move upward to the end of the sky.

original: cittaṃ ca vijñānamadhyasthitaṃ ca gatvā yathā pūrvakṛtena karmāṇā /
analyzed: cittam ca vijñāna madhya sthitam ca gatvā yathā pūrva kṛtena karmāṇā
translated: And the mind, which is located in the middle of consciousness, having gone according to previous actions,

original: deve manuṣyaeṣu ca triṣvapāyā yathākṛtaṃ pūrvabhave pravarttyā // / //
analyzed: deve manuṣya eṣu ca triṣu apāyāḥ yathākṛtam pūrva bhave pravarttyā
translated: In gods, humans, and the three lower realms, operates according to what was done in previous existences.

analyzed: śleṣma anila pitta kṣaya anta prāptaḥ kāyaḥ śakṛt mūtra parīṣa pūrṇaḥ
translated: The body, filled with feces, urine, and impurities, ends in the destruction of phlegm, wind, and bile.

original: nirābhirāmaḥ kṛmikṣudrapūrṇaḥ kṣiptaḥ śmaśāne yatha kāṣṭhabhūtaḥ // / //
analyzed: nira abhirāmaḥ kṛmi kṣudra pūrṇaḥ kṣiptaḥ śmaśāne kāṣṭha bhūtaḥ
translated: It is thrown into the charnel ground, like a log, full of worms and small creatures, devoid of joy.

original: paśyāhi tvaṃ devata ebhi evaṃ katyatra sattvastatha pudgalo vā /
analyzed: paśyāhi tvam devate ebhiḥ evam pudgalaḥ vā
translated: You see, O god, that it is thus: how much truth is there here of a being or person?

analyzed: bagchi
translated: Bagchi

original: śūnyā hi ete khalu sarvadharmā avidyataḥ pratyayasaṃbhavāśca // / //
analyzed: śūnyāḥ hi ete khalu sarva dharmāḥ avidyataḥ pratyaya saṃbhavāḥ ca
translated: For all these dharmas are indeed empty, arising from conditions that do not exist.

analyzed: ete sarvāḥ ca yasmāt mahābhūta prakṛti abhāvāḥ
translated: These great elements are unreal, and all of them are so, because of the non-existence of the nature of the great elements.

original: tasmācca bhūtā hi asaṃbhavāśca avidyamānā na kadāci vidyate // / //
analyzed: tasmāt ca bhūtāḥ hi asaṃbhavāḥ ca a vidyamānāḥ na kadācid vidyate
translated: And because of the impossibility of the elements, the non-existent has never existed.

analyzed: avidyataḥ pratyaya saṃbhavāḥ ca avidyamāna eva avidya vācaḥ
translated: Arising from non-existent conditions, the non-existent itself is spoken of as non-existent.

original: tasmānmayā ukta avidya eṣā saṃskāravijñāna sanāmarūpam // / //
analyzed: tasmāt mayā ukta avidyaḥ eṣā saṃskāra vijñāna sa nāma rūpam
translated: Therefore, this non-existence has been stated by me: formations, consciousness, name-and-form,

original: ṣaḍāyatanasparśa tathaiva vedanā tṛṣṇā upādāna tathā bhavaśca /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana sparśa tathā eva vedanā tṛṣṇā upādāna tathā bhavaḥ ca
translated: The six sense bases, contact, and likewise feeling, craving, grasping, and becoming,

analyzed: jāti jarā maraṇa śoka upadravāṇām duḥkhāni saṃskāra acintiyāni
translated: Birth, old age, death, sorrow, and calamities - the formations of inconceivable sufferings.

original: saṃsāracakre ca yathā sthitāni abhūta saṃbhūta asaṃbhavāśca /
analyzed: saṃsāra cakre ca yathā sthitāni abhūta saṃbhūta asaṃbhavāḥ ca
translated: And as the cycles of existence are situated, with their unreal, arisen, and unarisen [phenomena],

analyzed: ayoniśas citta vicāraṇam tathā dṛṣṭīgatam chetsyatha ātmanā eva
translated: In the same way, you will cut through the views with your own mind, through proper mental investigation.

original: jñānāsinā chindatha kleśajālaṃ skandhālayaṃ paśyatha śūnyabhūtam /
analyzed: jñāna asinā chindatha kleśa jālam skandha ālayam paśyatha śūnya bhūtam
translated: With the sword of wisdom, cut through the net of afflictions, and see the abode of the aggregates as empty.

original: sparśetha taṃ bodhiguṇaṃ hyudāraṃ vivarta ca me amṛtapurasya dvāram // / //
analyzed: sparśetha tam bodhi guṇam hi udāram vivarta ca me amṛta purasya dvāram
translated: You will experience that vast quality of enlightenment, and open for me the door to the city of immortality.

original: saṃdarśi taṃ amṛtapurasya bhājanaṃ pravekṣya taṃ amṛtapurālayaṃ śubham /🔽Bagchi
analyzed: saṃdarśi tam amṛta purasya bhājanam pravekṣya tam amṛta pura ālayam śubham  bagchi
translated: You will reveal that vessel for the city of immortality, and enter that auspicious abode of the city of immortality.🔽You will satisfy with the nectar of immortality those who are tormented by the fire of afflictions.

original: tarpiṣya ha amṛtatarasena ātmanāṃ parāhatā me varadharmabherīḥ // / //
analyzed: tarpiṣya ha amṛtatarasena ātmanām parāhatāḥ me vara dharma bherīḥ
translated: You will beat for me the supreme Dharma drum.

original: āpūrito me varadharmaśaṅkhaḥ prajvālitā me varadharma ulkā /
analyzed: āpūritaḥ me vara dharma śaṅkhaḥ prajvālitā me vara dharmaḥ ulkā
translated: I have filled the supreme Dharma conch, I have ignited the supreme Dharma torch.

original: suvarṣitaṃ me varadharmavarṣaṃ parājitā me parakleśaśatravaḥ // / //
analyzed: su varṣitam me vara dharma varṣam parājitāḥ me para kleśa śatravaḥ
translated: I have rained down the supreme Dharma rain, I have defeated my enemies, the afflictions.

original: ucchrepitaṃ me varadharmadhvajaṃ pratāritā me bhavasattvasamudrāḥ /
analyzed: ucchrepitam me vara dharma dhvajam pratāritāḥ me bhava sattva samudrāḥ
translated: I have raised the supreme Dharma banner, I have liberated the ocean of beings from existence.

original: pidhitāni me 'pāyapathāni trīṇi kleśāgnidāhaṃ śamayitva prāṇinām // / //
analyzed: pidhitāni me pāya pathāni trīṇi kleśa agni dāham prāṇinām
translated: I have closed the three lower paths, and having extinguished the burning fire of afflictions for living beings.

original: yasmāddhi pūrvamahamanekakalpān acintiyā pūjitva nāyakā hi /
analyzed: yasmāt hi pūrvam aham aneka kalpān hi
translated: Because in the past, for many eons, I made inconceivable offerings to the guides,

analyzed: caritvā bodhāya dṛḍha vratena saddharmakāyam pariveṣamāṇaḥ
translated: Practicing with firm vows for the sake of enlightenment, serving the body of the true Dharma.

original: hastau ca pādau ca parityajitvā dhanaṃ hiraṇyaṃ maṇimuktabhūṣaṇam /
analyzed: hastau ca pādau ca parityajitvā dhanam hiraṇyam maṇi mukta bhūṣaṇam
translated: Having given up my hands and feet, my wealth, gold, jewels, pearls, and ornaments,

analyzed: nayana uttamāṅgam priya dāra putram suvarṇa vaiḍūrya vicitra ratnāni
translated: My eyes, head, my beloved wife and children, my gold, lapis lazuli, and various precious things,

original: chinditvā trisāhasrāyāṃ sarvavṛkṣavanaspatīm /🔽sarvaṃ ca cūrṇayitvā tat kuryāt sūkṣmarajopamam // / //
analyzed: chinditvā tri sāhasrāyām sarva vṛkṣa vanaspatīm  sarvam ca cūrṇayitvā tat kuryāt sūkṣma raja upamam
translated: Having cut down all the trees and plants in the three thousand worlds,🔽And having ground them all into fine dust,

analyzed: cūrṇa rāśim karitvā tu yāvat ākāśa gocaram
translated: Having made a heap of that dust extending as far as the realm of space,

original: aśakadbhabhāgabhinnāya dharaṇīrajaḥsamāni vā // / //🔽Bagchi 🔽sarvasattvā aneke hi jñānavata tathaiva ca /
analyzed: aśakat bha bhāga bhinnāya dharaṇī rajaḥ samāni vā  bagchi  sarva sattvāḥ aneke hi tathā eva ca
translated: It would not be possible to count even a fraction of it, equal to the dust on the earth.

original: sarvaṃ gaṇayituṃ śakyaṃ na tu jñātaṃ jinasya ca // / //
analyzed: sarvam gaṇayitum śakyam na tu jñātam jinasya ca
translated: All the many beings, even those with knowledge, could not count it, but the Victor knows it.

analyzed: eka kṣaṇa pravṛttam tu yat jñānam ca mahā muneḥ
translated: In a single instant, the great sage's knowledge,

analyzed: aneka kalpa koṭīṣu na śakyam gaṇayitum kvacid
translated: Which cannot be counted anywhere in many millions of eons,

analyzed: iti śrī suvarṇaprabhāsottama sūtra indrarāje śūnyatāparivartaḥ nāma ṣaṣṭhaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter in the Sublime Golden Light, King of Sutras, called Emptiness.

analyzed: bagchi
translated: Bagchi

analyzed: catur mahārāja parivartaḥ

analyzed: atha khalu vaiśravaṇaḥ mahā rājaḥ dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ mahā rājaḥ virūḍhakaḥ mahā rājaḥ virūpākṣaḥ
translated: Then the great king Vaishravana, the great king Dhritarashtra, the great king Virudhaka, and the great king Virupaksha

analyzed: mahā rāja uttha āyasanebhyaḥ eka aṃsena cīvarāṇi prāvṛtya dakṣiṇa jānu maṇḍalāni pṛthivyām
translated: rose from their seats, draped their upper robes over one shoulder, placed their right knees on the ground,

translated: bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, and said to the Blessed One:

analyzed: ayam bhagavan
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indra rājaḥ sarva tathāgata bhāṣitaḥ sarva tathāgata avalokitaḥ
translated: this Sublime Golden Light Sutra, King of Sutras, is spoken by all Tathagatas, observed by all Tathagatas,

translated: accompanied by all Bodhisattvas, revered by all Bodhisattva assemblies, worshipped by all celestial assemblies, delights all celestial kings,

original: sarvalokapālastutaḥ stavito varṇitaḥ praśaṃsitaḥ sarvadevabhavanāvabhāsitaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ
analyzed: sarva lokapāla stutaḥ stavitaḥ varṇitaḥ praśaṃsitaḥ sarva deva bhavana avabhāsitaḥ sarva sattvānām
translated: is praised, extolled, and lauded by all world guardians, illuminates all celestial abodes, and benefits all beings,
It bestows the highest happiness, purifies the sufferings of all hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama, and pacifies all fears.
It turns back all hostile armies, pacifies famines and calamities, and destroys diseases and calamities. It illuminates wisdom,
brings supreme peace, pacifies sorrow and distress, and pacifies various calamities. It destroys hundreds of thousands of calamities.

original: imamasya bhadanta bhagavan suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājasya vistareṇa parṣadi saṃprakāśyamānasyāsmākaṃ catūrṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sabalaparivārāṇām
analyzed: imam asya bhadanta bhagavan suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indra rājasya vistareṇa parṣadi saṃprakāśyamānasya asmākam catūrṇām mahā rājānām sa bala parivārāṇām
translated: Venerable Blessed One, when this excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, is being extensively taught to the assembly, for us four great kings, our armies and retinues,

original: etena ca dharmaśravaṇena dharmāmṛtarasena ca divyātmabhāvamahātejasā vivardhayiṣyanti //🔽asmākaṃ kāyeṣu vīryaṃ ca balaṃ sthāma ca saṃjanitaṃ bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: etena ca dharma śravaṇena dharma amṛta rasena ca divya ātmabhāva mahā tejasā vivardhayiṣyanti  asmākam kāyeṣu vīryam ca balam sthāma ca saṃjanitam bhaviṣyanti
translated: by listening to this Dharma and by the nectar-like taste of the Dharma, our divine bodies will greatly increase in splendor.🔽Strength, power, and stamina will be generated in our bodies.

original: tejaśca śriyaṃ ca lakṣmīṃ cāsmākaṃ kāyeṣvāviśanti /
analyzed: tejaḥ ca śriyam ca lakṣmīm ca asmākam kāyeṣu āviśanti
translated: Splendor, glory, and grace will enter our bodies.

original: vayaṃ bhagavaṃścatvāro mahārājā dhārmikāśca dharmavādinaśca dharmarājā dharmeṇa vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍanaramahoragāṇāṃ 🔽rājatvaṃ kārayiṣyāmaḥ /🔽te vayaṃ bhagavan /

translated: We, Blessed One, the Four Great Kings, are righteous, proclaimers of the Dharma, Dharma kings. We, venerable Blessed One, will rule with Dharma over the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: catvāraḥ mahārājāḥ sārdham aṣṭāviṃśati yakṣa senāpatibhiḥ anekaiḥ ca yakṣa śata sahasraiḥ
translated: We, Blessed One, the Four Great Kings, together with the twenty-eight yakṣa generals and many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas,

analyzed: satata samitam sarve jambudvīpam divyena viśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣyakeṇa vyavalokayiṣyāma
translated: will always and continuously look upon all Jambudvīpa with divine, pure, and superhuman vision,

analyzed: ārakṣayiṣyāmaḥ paripācayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: protect it, and bring it to maturity.

analyzed: tena hetunā bhadanta bhagavan asmākam caturṇām mahārājānām lokapālaḥ iti saṃjñā utpāditā  bagchi
translated: For that reason, venerable Blessed One, the name 'Lords of the World' has arisen for us Four Great Kings.

original: ye kecidbhadanta bhagavannasmin jambudvīpe viparyāsāḥ paracakreṇa copahatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: ye kecid bhadanta bhagavan asmin jambudvīpe viparyāsāḥ para cakreṇa ca upahatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those, venerable Blessed One, who in this Jambudvīpa are afflicted by the weapons of others,

translated: or who are afflicted by famine and various kinds of calamities, by hundreds of calamities, by thousands of calamities, by hundreds of thousands of calamities,

translated: “Bhadantâ Sugata, we four great kings will encourage this excellent Sūtra King Suvarṇa-prabhāsa and those monks who uphold this Sūtra King.

original: yadā ceme bhadanta bhagavan dharmabhāṇakā bhikṣavo 'smākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ saṃcodanayā
analyzed: yadā ca ime bhadanta bhagavan dharmabhāṇakāḥ bhikṣavaḥ smākam caturṇām mahārājānām saṃcodanayā
translated: “Bhadantâ Sugata, when those Dharma-preaching monks, by our encouragement,🔽by the Buddha’s blessing, go to those countries, in those countries they will

original: buddhādhiṣṭhānena ca yeṣu viṣayeṣūpasaṃkrameyusteṣu te viṣayeṣuḥ cemaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājaṃ
analyzed: buddha adhiṣṭhānena ca yeṣu viṣayeṣu upasaṃkrameyuḥ teṣu te ca imam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasūtra indrarājam
translated: expound this excellent Sūtra King Suvarṇa-prabhāsa

analyzed: vistareṇa saṃprakāśayeyuḥ
translated: in detail.

analyzed: ye imāni evaṃrūpāṇi viṣaya gata ati nānāvidhāni upadrava śatāni upadrava sahasrāni upadrava śata sahasrāṇi ca praśamayiṣyanti
translated: They will pacify the various hundreds of calamities, the various thousands of calamities, and the various hundreds of thousands of calamities that occur in those countries.”

original: yasya ca bhadanta bhagavan manuṣyarājasya viṣaye te sūtrendradhārakā bhikṣavā dharmabhāṇākā upasaṃkrāntā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: yasya ca bhadanta bhagavat manuṣya rājasya viṣaye te sūtra indra dhārakāḥ bhikṣavā dharma bhāṇākāḥ upasaṃkrāntāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: “Bhadantâ Sugata, in whatever country those monks who uphold this Sūtra King and preach the Dharma will go,

original: ayaṃ ca manuṣyarāja imaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsasūtrendrarājaṃ śṛṇyāt /
analyzed: ayam ca manuṣya rājaḥ imam suvarṇa prabhāsa sūtra indra rājam śṛṇyāt
translated: and if that human king listens to this Sūtra King Suvarṇa-prabhāsa,

original: śrutvā ca teṣāṃ sūtrendradhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ sarvapratyarthikebhya ārakṣāṃ kuryāt paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: śrutvā ca teṣām sūtra indra dhārakāṇām bhikṣūṇām sarva pratyarthikebhyaḥ ārakṣām kuryāt paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam kuryāt
translated: Having heard it, he should provide protection from all adversaries for those monks who uphold this Sutra of the Great Collection. He should provide them with rescue, support, and defense.

original: te vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan catvāro mahārājāstasya manuṣyarājasya sarvaviṣayagatānāṃ ca sattvānāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ
analyzed: te vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahārājāḥ tasya manuṣya rājasya sarva viṣaya gatānām ca sattvānām ārakṣām kariṣyāmaḥ paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam
translated: We, Venerable Blessed One, the Four Great Kings, will provide protection, rescue, support, and defense for all beings living in that entire dominion of that human king.

analyzed: śānti svastyayanam kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will bring about peace and well-being.

original: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavan sarvamanuṣyarājaḥ sūtrendradhārakāṇāṃ bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikānāṃ sarvasukhopadhānaiḥ sukhatāṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavan sarva manuṣya rājaḥ sūtra indra dhārakāṇām bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikānām sarva sukhopadhānaiḥ sukha tām kuryāt
translated: When, Venerable Blessed One, that human king provides all forms of happiness to the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers who uphold the Sutra of the Great Collection,

original: te vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan catvāro mahārājāstaṃ manuṣyarājaṃ sarvarājebhyaḥ satkṛtataraṃ
analyzed: te vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ tam manuṣya rājam sarva rājebhyaḥ satkṛtataram
translated: we, Venerable Blessed One, the Four Great Kings, will make that human king more honored than all other kings,

original: kariṣyāmo gurukṛtaṃ ca kariṣyāmo mānitaṃ ca pūjitaṃ ca sarvaviṣayeṣu ca prasaṃśanīyaṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: kariṣyāmaḥ gurukṛtam ca kariṣyāmaḥ mānitam ca pūjitam ca sarva viṣayeṣu ca prasaṃśanīyam kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: more revered, more esteemed, and more worshipped, and we will praise him in all his dominions.

analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān caturṇām mahārājānām sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to the Four Great Kings:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā rājāḥ sādhu sādhu yuṣmākam mahā rājāḥ
translated: Good, good, great kings! Good, good, you great kings!

analyzed: yathā api te yūyam pūrva jina kṛta adhikārāḥ avaropita kuśala mūlāḥ bahu buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasra paryupāsitā
translated: Just as you have previously made offerings to many hundreds of thousands of millions of buddhas, planted roots of virtue, and have been attended by many hundreds of thousands of millions of buddhas,

original: dharmikāśca dharmavādinaśca dharmeṇa devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca rājatvaṃ kārayadhvam /
analyzed: dharmikāḥ ca dharma vādinaḥ ca dharmeṇa devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca rāja tvam kārayadhvam
translated: you should rule over gods and humans with the Dharma, speaking the Dharma, and with the Dharma.

original: yathāpi pūrvadīrgharātraṃ sarvasattvānāṃ hitacittāḥ sukhamaitrīcittāḥ sarvasattvahitasukhādhyāśayapratipannāḥ Bagchi
analyzed: yathā api pūrva dīrgharātram sarva sattvānām hita cittāḥ sukha maitrī cittāḥ sarva sattva hita sukha adhyāśaya pratipannāḥ
translated: Just as in the past for a long time you have had the thought of benefiting all beings, the thought of happiness and friendliness, and have practiced with the superior intention of benefiting and making all beings happy,

original: sarvāhitapratiṣedhikāḥ sarvasattvānāṃ sarvahitopasaṃhārābhiyuktāḥ /🔽te yūyaṃ catvāro mahārājāsteṣāṃ manuṣyarājasya ca suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājasya
analyzed: sarva ahita pratiṣedhikāḥ sarva sattvānām sarva hita upasaṃhāra abhiyuktāḥ  te yūyam catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ teṣām manuṣya rājasya ca suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasūtra indra rājasya
translated: opposing all harm, and being devoted to bringing about all benefit and happiness for all beings,🔽you four great kings should provide protection, rescue, embrace, guard, peace, and well-being for that human king who is devoted to making offerings and paying respect to the excellent king of sūtras called Suvarṇa-prabhāsa,

original: pūjāsatkārābhiyuktānāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyata paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kariṣyata /

analyzed: tena yuṣmābhiḥ catur mahārājaiḥ sa bala parivāraiḥ anekaiḥ ca yakṣa śata sahasraiḥ atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām
translated: Therefore, you four great kings, together with your armies and retinues, and with many hundreds of thousands of yakshas, to the Buddhas of the past, present, and future,

analyzed: buddhānām bhagavatām dharma netrī ārakṣitā bhaviṣyati paripālitā ca parigṛhītā ca bhaviṣyati

original: tena yuṣmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sabalaparivārāṇamanekeṣāṃ yakṣaśatasahasrāṇāṃ devānāṃ devāsurasaṃgrāme jayo bhaviṣyati /

translated: For that reason, you four great kings, together with your armies and retinues, and with many hundreds of thousands of gods, will have victory in the battle between the gods and asuras.

analyzed: asurāṇām ca parijayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The asuras will be defeated.

original: sarvaparacakrapramardakasya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājasyārthāya teṣāṃ sūtrendradhārakāṇāṃ🔽bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikānāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyata paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ
analyzed: sarva para cakra pramardakasya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indra rājasya arthāya teṣām sūtra indra dhārakāṇām  bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikānām ārakṣām kariṣyata paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam
translated: For the sake of the Sutra of Golden Light, the excellent king of sutras that conquers all enemies,🔽you will provide protection, rescue, embrace, and guard for those who uphold this sutra,

analyzed: śānti svastyayanam kariṣyata
translated: whether they are monks, nuns, male or female lay followers, and will bring about peace and well-being for them.

translated: Then the great king Vaishravana, the great king Dhritarashtra, the great king Virudhaka, and the great king Virupaksha,

analyzed: utthāya āsanebhyaḥ eka aṃsāni cīvaraiḥ prāvṛtya dakṣiṇāni jānu maṇḍalāni pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya

analyzed: yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: They bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said this to the Blessed One:

translated: Venerable Blessed One,🔽in the future, wherever this excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra-Indra of Golden Light, will be practiced in villages, towns, cities, regions, countries, and capitals,

analyzed: kaścid bhadanta bhagavat manuṣya rājaḥ bhagavan yena anena deva indra samayena rāja śāsreṇa rāja tvam kārayet  asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya śrotā bhavan tāḥ ca sūtra indra dhārakā
translated: and, Venerable Blessed One, if some human king, Blessed One, were to rule through this treaty of the king of gods, this royal law,🔽and if he were a listener of this excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra-Indra of Golden Light, and if those holders of the Sūtra-Indra

analyzed: bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet satata samitam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indra rājam śṛṇuyāt
translated: monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen were to honor, respect, esteem, and worship him, and if he were to constantly and always listen to the excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra-Indra of Golden Light,

translated: By this Dharma discourse, may the divine bodies of us four great kings,

analyzed: mahāntam vīryam ca sthāma ca balam ca asmākam kāyeṣu tejaḥ śriyaḥ ca lakṣmī ca asmākam vivardhayet  tena vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ sa bala parivārāḥ anekaiḥ
translated: May our bodies be greatly increased in strength, power, and energy, and may our glory and prosperity be increased.🔽Therefore, venerable Blessed One, we four great kings, with our armies and retinues, and with many hundreds of thousands of invisible yakshas,

translated: now and in the future, wherever we go to villages, towns, cities, countries, kingdoms, and capitals,

translated: there this supreme sutra king Suvarnaprabhasa will be practiced.

analyzed: teṣām ca manuṣya rājānām asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya śrotṝṇām mātā pitṝṇām ca ārakṣām kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: And we will protect those human kings who listen to this supreme sutra king Suvarnaprabhasa and their parents.

original: paritrāṇaṃ paripālanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śasraparihāraṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ ca kariṣyāmaḥ /🔽teṣāṃ ca rājakulānāṃ teṣāṃ ca rāṣṭrāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca viṣayāṇāmārakṣāṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /

translated: We will provide protection, guard, ward off punishment, ward off weapons, and bring about peace and well-being.

original: paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śasraparihāraṃ śāntisvastyayanaṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam daṇḍa parihāram śasra parihāram śānti svastyayanam kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will provide protection, guard, ward off punishment, ward off weapons, and bring about peace and well-being for those royal families, those kingdoms, and those countries.

original: tāṃśca viṣayān sarvabhayopāyāsebhyaḥ parimocayiṣyāmaḥ paracakrāṇi ca pratinivartayiṣyāmaḥ /

translated: We will liberate those countries from all dangers and calamities, and we will turn back the armies of others.

original: yaḥ kaścit tasya manuṣyarājasya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya śroturmānayituḥ pūjayituranyaḥ sāmantakaḥ pratiśatrurājā bhavet /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid tasya manuṣya rājasya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya śrotuḥ mānayituḥ pūjayituḥ anyaḥ sāmantakaḥ pratiśatru rājā bhavet
translated: If any neighboring enemy king of that human king who listens to, respects, and worships the excellent sūtra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa should arise,

analyzed: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavan tasya sāmantakasya pratiśatroḥ rājñaḥ evam cittam utpādet
translated: and if, Venerable Blessed One, the mind of that neighboring enemy king should arise thus:

original: so 'haṃ caturaṅgena balakāyena sārdhamasya viṣayamupasaṃkrameyaṃ vināśayitum /
analyzed: saḥ ham caturaṅgena balakāyena sārdham asya viṣayam upasaṃkrameyam vināśayitum
translated: I, together with the four divisions of my army, will go to his country to destroy it,

original: tena khalu punarbhadanta bhagavān kālena tena samayenāsya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya
analyzed: tena khalu punar bhadanta bhagavān kālena tena samayena asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya
translated: Venerable Blessed One, at that time, by the power and splendor of this excellent sūtra king Suvarṇa-prabhāsa,

original: sūtrendrarājasya tejo 'nubhāvena tasya sāmantakasya pratiśatrurājasyānyai rājabhiḥ🔽sārdhaṃ saṃgrāme bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sūtra indra rājasya tejaḥ nubhāvena tasya sāmantakasya pratiśatru rājasya anyaiḥ rājabhiḥ  sārdham saṃgrāme bhaviṣyati
translated: the neighboring hostile king will have a battle with other kings.

analyzed: sva viṣaya gatāḥ ca viṣaya vilopāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will enter their own territories and destroy the territories of others.

analyzed: dāruṇāḥ ca rāja saṃkṣobhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: There will be terrible disturbances caused by the king.

analyzed: graha rogāḥ ca viṣaye prādubhūtāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Epidemic diseases will appear in the country.

analyzed: nānā vyākṣepa śatāni viṣaye prādurbhūtāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Hundreds of various calamities will appear in the country.

original: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavaṃstasya sāmantakasya pratiśatrurājasya svaviṣayagatānyevaṃrūpāṇi nānopadravaśatāni nānāvyakṣepaśatāni bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yadā ca bhadanta bhagavan tasya sāmantakasya pratiśatru rājasya sva viṣaya gatāni evaṃrūpāṇi nānā upadrava śatāni nānā vyakṣepa śatāni bhaveyuḥ
translated: Venerable Blessed One, when such hundreds of various calamities and hundreds of various disturbances occur in the neighboring hostile king's own territory,

original: sa ca bhadanta bhagavan sāmantakapratiśatrurājaścaturaṅgīṇīṃ senāṃ yojayitvā paracakragamanāya svaviṣayānniṣkrānto bhavet /
analyzed: sa ca bhadanta bhagavan sāmantaka pratiśatru rājaḥ caturaṅgīṇīm senām yojayitvā para cakra gamanāya sva viṣayāt niṣkrāntaḥ bhavet
translated: then, Venerable Blessed One, that neighboring hostile king, having assembled the four divisions of his army, will set out from his own territory to attack the enemy.

original: yatrāyaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaḥ sutrendrarājo bhavet sa pratiśatrurājaḥ sārdhaṃ caturaṅgabalakāyena taṃ viṣayamupasaṃkramitukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: yatra ayam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamaḥ sutra indra rājaḥ bhavet sa pratiśatru rājaḥ sārdham caturaṅga balakāyena tam viṣayam upasaṃkramitu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: Wherever this excellent sūtra king, the Sūtra of Golden Light, would be, that enemy king, together with his four-division army, would wish to approach that realm,

analyzed: tam vināśitu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: would wish to destroy it.

original: te vayaṃ bhadanta bhagavañcatvāro mahārājāḥ sabalaparivārā anekairyakṣarākṣasaśatasahasrairadṛśyairātmabhāvaistatropasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ
analyzed: te vayam bhadanta bhagavan catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ sa bala parivārāḥ anekaiḥ yakṣa rākṣasa śata sahasraiḥ adṛśyaiḥ ātmabhāvaiḥ tatra upasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We, Venerable Blessed One, the Four Great Kings, together with our armies and retinues, with many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas and rākṣasas, with invisible bodies, will approach there

analyzed: tam para cakram adhvānam mārga pratipannam bagchi
translated: and turn back that enemy army which has set out on the road,

original: tathaiva pratinivartayiṣyāmo nānāvyākṣepaśatāni copasaṃhariṣyāmo vighnāṃśca kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva pratinivartayiṣyāmaḥ nānā vyākṣepa śatāni ca upasaṃhariṣyāmaḥ vighnān ca kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: and we will create many hundreds of distractions and obstacles.

original: yathā ca tatparacakraṃ na śakṣyati tatra viṣaya upasaṃkramitum /
analyzed: yathā ca tat para cakram na śakṣyati tatra viṣaye upasaṃkramitum
translated: And so that enemy army will not be able to approach that realm,

analyzed: kutas punar vināśam kariṣyati
translated: how much less will it be able to destroy it.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃsteṣāṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ sādhukāramadāt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām caturṇām mahārājānām sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to the Four Great Kings, saying:

original: sādhu sādhu mahārājāḥ sādhu khalu punaryuṣmākaṃ mahārājānām /

original: mahābalaśca mahānagnabalavegadhārī cābhirūpaḥ prāsādiko darśanīyaḥ paramayā śubhavarṇapuṣkaratayā samanvāgataśca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mahā balaḥ ca mahā nagna bala vega dhārī ca abhirūpaḥ prāsādikaḥ darśanīyaḥ paramayā śubha varṇa puṣkara tayā samanvāgataḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: He will have great strength, great physical strength and speed, and he will be handsome, pleasing, and beautiful, endowed with the highest auspicious complexion.

analyzed: sarvatra jātiṣu tathāgata samavadhāna gataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In all his births he will be in the presence of the Tathagata.

analyzed: sarva kalyāṇa mitrāṇi ca pratilapsyate
translated: He will obtain all spiritual friends.

analyzed: aparimita puṇya skandhasya parigṛhītaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be endowed with an immeasurable heap of merit.”

original: imanyevaṃrūpāṇi mahārājaguṇānuśaṃsāni saṃpaśyamānena tena rājñā dharmabhāṇako yojanātpratyutthātavyaḥ /
analyzed: imani evaṃrūpāṇi mahā rāja guṇa anuśaṃsāni saṃpaśyamānena tena rājñā dharmabhāṇakaḥ yojanāt pratyutthātavyaḥ
translated: “Great King, seeing these kinds of great qualities and benefits, the king should rise up to greet the Dharma teacher from a distance of one league.

analyzed: tasya dharmabhāṇakasya antike śāstṛ saṃjñā utpādayitavyā
translated: In the presence of that Dharma teacher, he should arouse the perception of the Teacher.

original: evaṃ cittamutpādayitavyam /🔽adya mama śākyamunistathāgato 'rhansamyaksaṃbuddha iha rājakule pravekṣyati /
analyzed: evam cittam utpādayitavyam  adya mama śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iha rājakule pravekṣyati
translated: He should arouse the following thought:🔽‘Today the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Śākyamuni will enter this royal palace.

original: adya mama śākyamunistathāgato 'rhansamyaksaṃbuddha iha rājakule svajanamanuśasiṣyate /
analyzed: adya mama śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iha rājakule sva janam anuśasiṣyate
translated: Today the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Śākyamuni will instruct his own family in this royal palace.

analyzed: sarva loka vipratyayanīyam dharma śravaṇam śroṣyāmi
translated: I will hear the Dharma teaching that is contrary to the beliefs of the whole world.

analyzed: bagchi adya aham anena dharma śravaṇena avaivartikaḥ bhaviṣyāmi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Today, by this Dharma teaching, I will become irreversible from supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: adya mayā tathāgata koṭī niyuta śata śasrāṇi ārāgitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will please many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of tathāgatas.

original: adya mayātītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmacintyā mahatī vipulā vistīrṇā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: adya mayā atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām acintyā mahatī vipulā vistīrṇā pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: Today I have made inconceivable, great, vast, and extensive offerings to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present.

analyzed: adya mama naraka gati tiryagyoni yama loka duḥkhāni antaśas samucchinnāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today the sufferings of the hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama will be completely eradicated.

original: adya mayānekānāṃ brahmendrarājatvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrātmabhāvapratilabdhānāṃ kuśalamūlabījānyavaropitāni bhaviṣyanti /🔽adya mayānekānāṃ śakrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrātmabhāvapratilabdhānāṃ kuśalamūlānyavaropitāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: adya mayā anekānām brahma indra rāja tva koṭī niyuta śata sahasra ātmabhāva pratilabdhānām kuśala mūla bījāni avaropitāni bhaviṣyanti  adya mayā anekānām śakra koṭī niyuta śata sahasra ātmabhāva pratilabdhānām kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will have planted the seeds of virtue for attaining the bodies of many hundreds of thousands of millions of Brahmas, Indras, and kings.🔽Today I will have planted the roots of virtue for attaining the bodies of many hundreds of thousands of millions of Shakra.

analyzed: adya mayā anekāni cakravarti rāja koṭī niyuta śata sahasra ātmabhāva pratilabdhānām kuśala mūla bījāni avaropitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will have planted the seeds of virtue for attaining the bodies of many hundreds of thousands of millions of Chakravartin kings.

analyzed: adya mayā sattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi saṃsārāt parimocitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will have liberated many hundreds of thousands of millions of beings from samsara.

analyzed: adya mayā acintya su vipula vistīrṇa a pāramita puṇya skandhaḥ parigṛhītaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today I will have accumulated an inconceivable, extremely vast, immeasurable, and limitless heap of merit.

original: adya mama sarvāntaḥpurasya mahatyārakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: adya mama sarva antaḥpurasya mahatī ārakṣā kṛtā bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today, a great protection will have been made for my entire harem.

original: adya mama rājakule 'cintyā samabiśiṣṭānuttarā mahatī śāntiḥ kṛtā bhaviṣyati svastyayanaṃ ca /
analyzed: adya mama rāja kule cintyā sama biśiṣṭā anuttarā mahatī śāntiḥ kṛtā bhaviṣyati svastyayanam ca
translated: Today, an inconceivable, excellent, unsurpassed, great peace and well-being will have been made in my royal palace.

analyzed: adya mama ayam sarva viṣayaḥ ārakṣitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Today, this entire realm of mine will be protected.

original: paripālitaścānutpīḍitaścānutkaṇṭhikaśca sarvaparacakrānavamarditaścānupasargaścānupāyāsaśca bhaviṣyati //🔽yadā ca mahārājāḥ sa manuṣyarājo 'nenaivaṃrūpeṇa saddharmagauraveṇa suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarājadhārakā
analyzed: paripālitaḥ ca an utpīḍitaḥ ca an utkaṇṭhikaḥ ca sarva para cakra an avamarditaḥ ca an upasargaḥ ca an upāyāsaḥ ca bhaviṣyati  yadā ca mahā rājāḥ sa manuṣya rājaḥ nena evaṃrūpeṇa saddharma gauraveṇa suvarṇa prabhāsa uttama sūtra indrarāja dhārakā
translated: It will be guarded, free from oppression, free from anxiety, unassailable by any foreign armies, free from misfortune, and free from calamity.🔽Great Kings, when that human king, with such reverence for the true Dharma, honors, venerates, and worships the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās who uphold the Sūtra of Golden Light, the King of Sutras,

analyzed: bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet yuṣmākam caturṇām mahārājānām
translated: and gives you, the Four Great Kings,

original: sabalaparivārāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca devagaṇānāmanekeṣāṃ ca yakṣaśatasahasrāṇāṃ mahā tathā
analyzed: sa bala parivārāṇām teṣām ca deva gaṇānām anekeṣām ca yakṣa śata sahasrāṇām mahā tathā
translated: together with your armies and retinues, and to those hosts of gods and many hundreds of thousands of yakṣas, a great

original: dharmāṅgapratyakṣaṃ dadyāt yena caivāsau manuṣyarājaḥ puṇyabhisaṃskāreṇa kuśalābhisaṃskāreṇa
analyzed: dharma aṅga pratyakṣam dadyāt yena ca eva asau manuṣya rājaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāreṇa kuśala abhisaṃskāreṇa
translated: direct witness of the Dharma, then by that very act of merit, that act of goodness,

original: ca tenaiva cātmabhāvena ca dṛṣṭadhārmikeṇācintyena mahatā rājyaiśvaryeṇa vivardhayiṣyati /
analyzed: ca tena eva ca ātmabhāvena ca dṛṣṭa dhārmikeṇa acintyena mahatā rājya aiśvaryeṇa vivardhayiṣyati
translated: And with that very present body, he will increase with inconceivable and great royal power and dominion.

analyzed: dṛṣṭa dhārmikeṇa acintyena mahatā rāja tejasā samanvāgataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be endowed with inconceivable and great royal splendor in this very life.

original: śriyā ca tejasā ca lakṣmyā cālaṃkṛto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: śriyā ca tejasā ca lakṣmyā ca alaṃkṛtaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be adorned with glory, splendor, and beauty.

analyzed: sarva pratyarthikāḥ ca sarva śatravaḥ ca sahadharmeṇa su nigṛhītāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And all his adversaries and enemies will be well restrained by the Dharma.

analyzed: bagchi
translated: Bagchi

analyzed: evam ukte catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: When this was said, the Four Great Kings said to the Blessed One:

original: yaḥ kaścidbhadanta bhagavanmanuṣyarājo bhavet so 'nenaivaṃrūpeṇa dharmagauraveṇemaṃ suvarṇaprabhāsottamaṃ sūtrendrarājaṃ śṛṇuyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid bhadanta bhagavat manuṣya rājaḥ bhavet saḥ nena evaṃrūpeṇa dharma gauraveṇa imam suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamam sūtra indra rājam śṛṇuyāt
translated: Reverend Blessed One, whatever human king there may be who would listen to this excellent king of sūtras, the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, with such an attitude of Dharma

analyzed: tāḥ ca sūtra indra dhārakāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet
translated: and would honor, respect, esteem, and worship those monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who uphold this king of sūtras,

original: asmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāmarthāya tadrājakulaṃ suśodhitaṃ śodhayet /
analyzed: asmākam caturṇām mahārājānām arthāya tat rājakulam su śodhitam śodhayet
translated: and for our sake, the Four Great Kings, would have that royal palace well-cleaned and cleaned,

analyzed: nānā gandha udaka saṃsiktam kuryāt
translated: and would have it sprinkled with water mixed with various fragrances,

original: taṃ ca dharmaśrāvaṇamasmābhiścaturbhiśca mahārājaiḥ sārdhaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ śṛṇyādātmano 'rthāya sarvadevatā ca kiṃcinmātraṃ kuśalaṃ pratyakṣaṃ
analyzed: tam ca dharmaśrāvaṇam asmābhiḥ caturbhiḥ ca mahārājaiḥ sārdham sādhāraṇam śṛṇyāt ātmanaḥ rthāya sarva devatā ca kiṃcid mātram kuśalam pratyakṣam
translated: We, together with the four great kings, will listen to that Dharma teaching, which is shared, for the sake of ourselves and all the deities, and for the sake of a little bit of merit.

original: samantaraniṣaṇṇasya ca bhadanta bhagavaṃstasya bhikṣordhamāsanagatasya tena manuṣyarājenāsmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāmarthāya nānāgandhā dhūpayitavyāḥ
analyzed: samantara niṣaṇṇasya ca bhadanta bhagavan tasya bhikṣoḥ dham āsana gatasya tena manuṣya rājena asmākam caturṇām mahā rājānām arthāya nānā gandhāḥ dhūpayitavyāḥ
translated: Venerable Blessed One, as soon as that bhikṣu sits on the Dharma seat for the sake of us four great kings, various fragrances should be burned.

original: sahadhūpiteṣu bhadanta bhagavaṃstasya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya pūjārthāya nānāgandheṣu nānāgandhadhūpalatā niścaranti /
analyzed: saha dhūpiteṣu bhadanta bhagavan tasya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya pūjā arthāya nānā gandheṣu nānā gandha dhūpa latāḥ niścaranti
translated: Venerable Blessed One, when those various fragrances are burned for the sake of worshipping the excellent king of sūtras called the Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, various fragrant smoke-clouds will emerge from those various fragrances.

original: tasminneva kṣaṇalavamuhūrte 'smākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ svakasvakabhavanagatānyuparyantarīkṣe nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti /
analyzed: tasmin eva kṣaṇa lava muhūrte smākam caturṇām mahārājānām svaka svaka bhavana gatāni upari antarīkṣe nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: In that very moment, instant, and second, above the palaces of us four great kings, various fragrant smoke-cloud canopies will appear.

analyzed: udārān ca gandhān āghrāsyanti
translated: We will smell those superior fragrances.

analyzed: suvarṇa varṇa mayāḥ ca avabhāsāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: Golden-colored lights will appear.

analyzed: tena ca avabhāsena asmākam bhavanāni avabhāsitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: By that light, our palaces will be illuminated.

original: brahmaṇaḥ sahāṃpateḥ śakrasya ca devānāmindrasya sarasvatyāśca mahādevyā dṛḍhāyāśca🔽mahādevyāḥ śriyaśca mahādevyāḥ saṃjayasya ca mahāyakṣasenāpateraṣṭāviṃśatīnāṃ ca
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ sahāṃpateḥ śakrasya ca devānām indrasya sarasvatyāḥ ca mahādevyāḥ dṛḍhāyāḥ ca  mahādevyāḥ śriyaḥ ca mahādevyāḥ saṃjayasya ca mahā yakṣa senāpateḥ aṣṭāviṃśatīnām ca
translated: Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, Śakra, lord of the gods, the great goddess Sarasvatī, and the great goddess Dṛḍhā,

original: mahāyakṣasenāpatīnaṃ maheśvarasya ca devaputrasya vajrapāṇeśca mahāyakṣasenāpatermāṇibhadrasya
analyzed: mahā yakṣa senāpatīnam maheśvarasya ca devaputrasya vajrapāṇeḥ ca mahā yakṣa senāpateḥ māṇibhadrasya
translated: the great yakṣa general Saṃjaya, and the twenty-eight great yakṣa generals, the god Maheśvara, the great yakṣa general Vajrapāṇi, the great yakṣa general Maṇibhadra,

analyzed: ca mahā yakṣa senāpateḥ hārītyāḥ ca pañca putra śata parivārāṇām anavataptasya ca nāga rājasya
translated: and the five hundred sons and their retinues of Hārītī, and the nāga king Anavatapta,

analyzed: ca eteṣām bhadanta bhagavan svaka svaka bhavana gatānām
translated: these, Venerable Blessed One, will be in their own abodes.

analyzed: tena kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena upari antarīkṣe nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: In that very moment, instant, and second, parasols made of various fragrant incense creepers will be established in the upper atmosphere.

analyzed: udārān ca nānā gandhān āghrāsyanti
translated: They will smell the various fragrances.

analyzed: suvarṇa varṇa mayāḥ ca avabhāsāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: Golden-colored lights will appear.

analyzed: tayā ca avabhāsayā sarva bhavanāni avabhāsitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: And by that light, all the abodes will be illuminated.

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān caturaḥ mahā rājān etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the Four Great Kings:

original: na kevalaṃ yuṣmākaṃ caturṇāṃ mahārājānāṃ svakasvakabhavanagatānāmuparyantarīkṣagatāti nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti /
analyzed: na kevalam yuṣmākam caturṇām mahārājānām svaka svaka bhavana gatānām upari antarīkṣa gatā ati nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: Not only will canopies of various fragrant incense creepers appear in the sky above your own palaces, O Four Great Kings.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sahapradhūpitāśca mahārājāstena manuṣyarājena nānāgandhā asya suvarṇaprabhāsottamasya sūtrendrarājasya pūjopasthānāya /
analyzed: saha pradhūpitāḥ ca mahā rājāḥ tena manuṣya rājena nānā gandhāḥ asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya pūjā upasthānāya
translated: Because, O Great Kings, the human king will have together with the incense offered to this excellent king of sūtras, the Sūtra of Golden Light, for the sake of worship and service.

analyzed: tatas ca eva dhūpa kuṇḍa hasta parigṛhītāḥ nānā gandha dhūpa latāḥ niścariṣyanti
translated: Then, from the incense burners held in their hands, various fragrant incense creepers will emerge.

original: tena kṣaṇalavamuhūrtena sarvasyāmasyāṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau yatra koṭīśataṃ candrāṇāṃ Bagchi
analyzed: tena kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena sarvasyām asyām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau yatra koṭī śatam candrāṇām
translated: In that very moment, instant, and second, throughout this entire trichiliocosm, where there are a hundred million moons,

analyzed: koṭī śatam sumerūṇām parvata rājānām koṭī śatam cakravāḍa mahācakravāḍānām parvata rājānām
translated: a hundred million Sumerus, kings of mountains, a hundred million Cakravāḍas and Mahācakravāḍas, kings of mountains,

analyzed: koṭī śatam catur mahā dvīpānām koṭī śatam catur mahārājakāyikānām devānām koṭī śatam trayastriṃśānām
translated: a hundred million four-continent worlds, a hundred million gods of the Four Great Kings, a hundred million gods of the Thirty-Three,

translated: up to a hundred million gods of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

analyzed: sarvatra ca teṣu tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu koṭī śateṣu trayastriṃśeṣu devanikāyeṣu
translated: And in all those hundreds of koṭis of worlds in the great trichiliocosm, in the thirty-three celestial realms,

analyzed: suvarṇa varṇa mayāḥ ca avabhāsāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti

translated: By those lights, all the abodes will be illuminated.

analyzed: ratna chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: Jewelled canopies will appear.

analyzed: udāra udārān ca gandhān āghrāsyanti sarva deva bhavaneṣu suvarṇa varṇa avabhāsāḥ prādurbhaviṣyanti
translated: In all the deva abodes, golden-colored lights will appear.

analyzed: tena ca avabhāsena sarva deva bhavanāni avabhāsitāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: By that light, all the deva abodes will be illuminated.

original: yathā trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau sarvadevabhavanānyuparyantarīkṣe tāni nānāgandhadhūpalatāchatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti /
analyzed: yathā tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau sarva deva bhavanāni upari antarīkṣe tāni nānā gandha dhūpa latā chatrāṇi saṃsthāsyanti
translated: Just as in the great trichiliocosm, in all the deva abodes, those canopies of various fragrances and incense will appear in the sky above,

analyzed: tathā ca asya mahā rājāḥ suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtrendra rājasya tejasā kuṇḍa hastena
translated: And by the splendor of this great king, the excellent king of sūtras called Suvarṇa-prabhāsa, with his hand holding a censer,

analyzed: dhūpitāḥ tena manuṣya rājena nānā gandhāḥ asya suvarṇa prabhāsa uttamasya sūtra indra rājasya

translated: And the beings in all the countries will be engaged in quarrels,🔽engaged in disputes, and will fall into arguments. And various kinds of diseases caused by planets will appear in the country.
